name: Anthony Deschamps
bio: I use Rust professionally in my day job, as well as for some hobby projects. I like it for a lot of technical reasons, but most of all for the great community.

name: Alex Kavanagh
bio: Rust is a refreshing alternative to C, C++ and golang.  I find it elegant, relatively concise and very interesting to use.  I've not used in professionally, yet, but have many years of C, JavaScript and Python under my belt.

name: Ludwig Stecher
bio: I study IT in Bavaria, Germany. Rust is one of my favourite languages because of its expressive type system, its strong safety guarantees and good WASM support. I also code a lot in Java, Kotlin, JS and Typescript.

name: Alpha Shuro
bio: Rust empowers developers to write code that is ambitious, fast and correct. Viva Rust!

name: Andrew Radev
bio: Rust is a language that feels as comfortable as the next Ruby. While I can't say I'm an expert quite yet, I've taught a university course in it, so I hope I've picked up enough skill to help beginners out.

name: David Carroll
bio: My primary professional language is Python, which I like for its flexibility and expressiveness, but I also enjoy using Rust because of its power and high-quality tooling.  I'm a former CS professor.
